intro: Scabiosa arvensis var. purpurea, commonly known as the purple field scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed areas. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it a valuable addition to wildflower gardens.
